Author: Acura#2748
Content: Statement from the researcher of the TITANIUM Project https://titanium-project.eu/ on ZCASH (EU project), which is concerned with deanonymizing various crypto currencies: The situation is more difficult with Zcash, another Bitcoin derivative, which can encrypt transactions itself using zero knowledge proofs. A colleague from Haslhofer researched it in the spring: "We can track normal transactions well, but if they use the Zcash shield, they are virtually anonymous. But that's only an extremely small part of the transactions." As long as this remains so, it is easy to separate Zcash's suspected criminal transactions from the decent ones. The Originaltext can be found here: https://bitcoinblog.de/2018/11/09/ransomware-erwirtschaftet-mickrige-ertraege-und-coinjoins-koennen-erkannt-werden/

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: Look. Here's my story with bitcoin and maybe you'll understand why I wrote the above

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: I started mining BTC early 2010 when it was worth $0.02

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: When it reached $1 i was so f8ckin happy that i lost track of bitcoin's mission and sold my stash. All of it. Rest of mining proceeds i sold and kept about 5% kinda hoping it will go up even more

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: In 2016 when it reached $200 i sold it all again (not a lot left) only to kick myself in the nuts in 2017 when btc was $18k

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: If i were to keep 30% over the years i would have been a millionaire now but i was short sighted and jolly'ed at pennies thinking it was a good ROI

Author: LoPhatMelk#9055

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: Never again! Pirate has great potential and I strongly believe that it will reach $xxx within the next 1-2 years. I don't mind the wait. I won't be selling anything until it reaches $xx and even then i'll only sell enough to pay for asics and power, nothing more

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: I'm doing a daily mental exercise in the morning as i'm tempted, every day, to cash out for power & % of asics cost and i'm thinking. I'm selling 1000ARRR for $120 now to pay for some measly bills, OK. And then i'm picturing myself in my bitcoin situation thinking at how i sold 1000ARRR for $120 when it's now worth $12000. That feeling is gut wrenching and i don't sell, I buy more on top of my mining

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: Of course i could be dead wrong and 1000ARRR could be by some unimaginary exponential force be brought down to $12. That's ok. That's a risk i'm willing to take
